results.title: RAAF Record. Newsreel No. 07
results.creator_credit: Stanley Brogden and Australia. Royal Australian Air Force. Directorate of Public Relations
results.brief_description: Cinemagazine newsreel includes the following: 1. The RAAF flight in the Antarctic use Canadian “Beaver” aircraft. 2. RAAF personnel are trained by firemen in Melbourne. 3. The Lockheed Hercules transport. 4. The “Jindivik” pilotless aircraft, designed and built in Australia, shown in flight at Woomera range.

results.title: The Queen Returns
results.creator_credit: Frank Bagnall, Stanley Hawes and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: The visit of Her Majesty Queen Elizabeth and His Royal Highness Prince Phillip to Australia. Much of the film is devoted to Canberra and its history as the Queen’s visit coincided with Canberra’s Jubilee Celebrations.

results.title: Queen cotton
results.creator_credit: Cecil Musk, C Beaumont and Merton Park
results.brief_description: Looks at the cotton industry in Lancashire which, in the middle of this century, supplied most of the world with cotton goods. Features cranes on the docks in Manchester unloading cotton from all over the world to supply the looms of Lancashire. Includes a fashion shows highlighting cotton fabrics used by well-known British designers. Photographed by Jimmy Rogers, music by William Alwyn and editing by C. Beaumont.

results.title: Planning for Melbourne's future
results.creator_credit: Geoffrey Thompson, Cine Service and Melbourne and Metropolitan Board of Works
results.brief_description: In 1949 the Melbourne Metropolitan Board of Works was asked to formulate a plan that would estimate the future needs of Melbourne. From information gathered through surveys, inspecting every street and alley to determine its use, this was made possible. “Planning for Melbourne’s Future” is photographed and directed by Geoffrey Thompson and is an examination of this plan. It is a rare and honest account of the deficiencies and lack of planning made to prepare Melbourne for an increase in future population growth.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Geoffrey Thompson, Cine Service and Melbourne and Metropolitan Board of Works

results.title: Planning a city
results.brief_description: Sydney, the second greatest white city in the British Empire. A critical analysis of Sydney and the initial lack of city planning. Despite the surrounding beauty and the opportunity for wise planning, Sydney became a crowded and poorly serviced city. Many houses were built on narrow, cramped and dimly lit streets which contributed to the escalation of crime and disease. Those responsible for constructing roadways rarely considered the impact on residents. Many schools and shopping centres were built on major thoroughfares resulting in a high rate of school children and housewives being killed by cars. Considering the harbourside location, many of the views became obstructed by buildings housing the privileged. The ‘Town and Country Planning Act of 1945’ was introduced to provide an opportunity to remedy the mistakes of the past by planning for future improvements. This film includes scenes of Sydney as it was in the middle of this century and what is now historical footage of cars, buses, trams, trains, ferries and horse and carts.

results.title: The Pictures that moved: Australian cinema 1896-1920
results.creator_credit: Alan Anderson, Frank Bagnall and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “History of Australian Cinema Series”.
Show the intense activity in the Australian film industry from the first screening at the Melbourne Opera House in 1896 to the decline of the industry in the early 1920’s. Extracts from productions of particular interest are shown, including “Soldiers of the cross”, “Living Hawthorn”, “The Story of the Kelly gang”, “A Girl of the bush”, “On our selection” and “The Sentimental bloke”, with stills, contemporary press reports and interviews. Shows the technical advances gained, and the exhibition of the national character in a wide range of films. Shows the running of the first filmed Melbourne Cup in 1896 and a finals game of VFL at the Melbourne Cricket Ground between South Melbourne and Carlton.
